pros: Supports Miracast and WiDi for easy wireless connections
High quality for both data images and video

customer_reviews.title: Nice for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Using at a church. Much better than the projector we replaced, but not quite as bright as the advertising made it sound. It's probably the best we could do in this price range and is absolutely beautiful in subdued lighting. It just leaves a bit to be desired in our sanctuary on a sunny day where a lot of light comes on through the windows. Operation is easy and the audio output connection sends a good clean signal to our sound board.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Jaubert

customer_reviews.title: Bright, clear, capable, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these projectors to use in live training events that my company does for groups of 25-200 people at a time. I am very pleased with the clarity and brightness of the projector. The auto-keystone features work well and the manual adjustments are intuitive, easy to figure out, and quite capable. I love the flexibility of inputs on this projector. Everything from wifi, VGA, and HDMI, to USB, ethernet and standard RCA. I have never not been able to connect and get the projector running. I would definitely purchase these projectors again.
customer_reviews.author: RedRocksRider

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Bright
customer_reviews.text: We use this in a corporate training environment, almost 100% with MiraCast (from a Surface Pro tablet or Surface Book). Works great. Bright. Sharp. The projector has a ton of auto-adjusting options available as well (like auto-sizing, auto-keystone correction, etc). They only thing that's odd is that these are disabled when you ceiling mount the projector. Strange, huh? In any case, this is a great unit. Well worth the $2K cost.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Epson blows away the competition!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, big, bright image! Easy to operate. Tested with content from DVD, BlueRay, YouTube, etc. Worked Great with all formats. Manual elevation via an up front lever, prior Sony had an automatic elevator, but this Epson has a much better image. Audio was ok for testing, but will use a professional PA system for large presentations. Zoom and Focus were easy to operate and this unit has many input channels, like 2 HDMI inputs, composite, etc. You can't go wrong with an almost 5,000 Lumens projector at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: L. Epstein

customer_reviews.text: These are about as good as these get. Sharp Bright picture. Not too loud, and has RS232 control capability. Will show 1080P images without scaling. Up to 1920x1200. These work better for color images than comparable DLP projectors. There are better projectors (laser light sources) but they cost much more.

product_meta.title: Epson EMP1985WU PowerLite LCD 1080p Projector
product_meta.description: The Power Lite 1985WU is a portable powerhouse, bringing brilliant high-definition video to your boardroom with native WUXGA, Full HD 1080p support, and Die video processing. Offering 3x Brighter Colors than competitive models, Epson 3LCD projectors ensure vivid images. With 4800 lumens of color brightness and 4800 lumens of white brightness1, the 1985WU shines bright. Easily display content from MHL-enabled devices. Or, wirelessly share content via Mira cast or Wii from smartphones, tablets and PCs. With the Power Lite 1985WU, it will look as good on the screen as it does on your device, but up to 300".
